arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَا أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
transliteration: Qala Rabbana dhalamna anfusana wa-in lam taghfir lana wa tarhamna lanakunna min al-khasireen.
english: Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy on us, we will surely be among the losers.
turkish: Rabbimiz, kendimize zulmettik. Eğer bizi bağışlamaz ve bize merhamet etmezseniz, muhakkak zarara uğrayanlardan oluruz.
context: After Adam and Eve ate the forbidden fruit, they realized their mistake and humbly sought Allah’s forgiveness.
reflection: When we err, admitting our faults and seeking Allah's forgiveness with humility is essential.

arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا
transliteration: Rabbighfir li wa liwaalidayya wa liman dakhala baytiya mu'minaan wa lilmu'mineena walmu'minaati wa la tazidiz zaalimeena illaa tabaaraa.
english: My Lord, forgive me, my parents, whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women. And do not let the wrongdoers increase except in ruin.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni, anne babamı, iman ederek evime girenleri ve bütün mümin erkekleri ile mümin kadınları bağışla. Zalimlerin ise ancak helakları artsın.
context: After the Flood, Prophet Nuh asked Allah to forgive him, his parents, and all believers, and to let only the injustices perish.
reflection: Reminds us to pray for our family and community along with ourselves when seeking forgiveness.

arabic: رَبِّ اجْعَلْنِي مُقِيمَ الصَّلَاةِ وَمِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِيۚ رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَائِي
transliteration: Rabbi ij'alni muqeema as-salati wa min dhurriyyati; Rabbana wa taqabbal du'a.
english: My Lord, make me and my descendants among those who establish prayer. Our Lord, accept our supplication.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni ve soyumdan gelenleri namazı hakkıyla kılanlardan eyle. Rabbimiz, dualarımızı kabul buyur.
context: Prophet Ibrahim prayed for himself and his descendants to be steadfast in prayer, and asked Allah to accept their prayers.
reflection: Highlights the importance of praying for future generations to remain devout in prayer alongside ourselves.

arabic: رَبَّنَا اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الْحِسَابُ
transliteration: Rabbanaghfir li wa liwalidayya wa lil-mumineena yawma yaqoomu al-hisab.
english: Our Lord, forgive me, my parents, and the believers on the Day when the account is established.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Hesapların görüleceği o gün beni, anne babamı ve bütün müminleri bağışla.
context: Prophet Ibrahim prayed for forgiveness for himself, his parents, and all believers on the Day of Judgment.
reflection: Emphasizes praying for the forgiveness of our family and the wider Muslim community, especially on the Day of Reckoning.

arabic: رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّاۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
transliteration: Rabbana taqabbal minna innaka anta as-samee'u al-'aleem.
english: Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Bunu bizden kabul buyur. Şüphesiz ki Sen, her şeyi işiten ve bilensin.
context: After building the Kaaba’s foundations, Prophet Ibrahim, with his son Ismail, asked Allah to accept their effort.
reflection: Teaches humility – even after a righteous deed, we seek Allah’s acceptance, recognizing His attributes of hearing and knowing.

arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنِّيٓ أَسْكَنْتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِيۖ بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِي زَرْعٍۖ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ ٱلْمُحَرَّمِۚ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَۖ فَٱجْعَلۡ أَفۡئِدَةً مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ تَهۡوِيٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ وَٱرۡزُقۡهُم مِّنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَشۡكُرُونَ
transliteration: Rabbanaa innee askantu min dhurriyyati biwaadin ghayri dhi zar'in 'inda baytika al-muharram; Rabbanaa liyuqeemu as-salata, faj'al af'ida tan mina n-nasi tahwee ilayhim, warzuqhum minath-thamarati la'allahum yashkuroon.
english: My Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in an uncultivated valley near Your Sacred House so they may establish prayer. So let some hearts among people incline toward them and provide them with fruits so they may be grateful.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Soyumdan bir kısmını, namazı dosdoğru kılmaları için, Beyt-i Haram’ın yanında ekinsiz bir vadiye yerleştirdim. İnsanlardan bir kısmının kalbini onlara yönelt ve onları meyvelerle rızıklandır ki şükretsinler.
context: Prophet Ibrahim placed his family near the Kaaba for devotion, and asked Allah to draw others’ support and provisions to them.
reflection: Shows caring for future generations’ faith and trusting Allah to attract blessings and support; encourages community solidarity.

arabic: إِنَّمَا أَشْكُو بَثِّي وَحُزْنِي إِلَى اللَّهِ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
transliteration: Innamaa ashkoo bathhee wa huznee ila Allah wa a'lamu min Allah ma la ta'lamoon.
english: I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.
turkish: Ben bütün dert ve kederimi ancak Allah’a şikayet ederim; Allah’tan gelen ilimle sizin bilmediğiniz birçok şeyi bilirim.
context: Prophet Yaqub, overwhelmed by sorrow at Yusuf’s (Joseph’s) loss, turned to Allah, trusting in His greater wisdom.
reflection: Reminds us to bring our hardships to Allah and trust His wisdom, even when we cannot see the full picture.

arabic: وَزَكَرِيَّا إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِيۤ فَرْدًا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
transliteration: Wazakariyya idh nada rabbahu rabbi la tazharni fardan wa anta khayru al-waritheen.
english: My Lord, do not leave me without an heir; indeed, You are the best of inheritors.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni çocuksuz bırakma; şüphesiz sen mirasçıların en hayırlısısın.
context: Prophet Zakariya prayed for a child in his old age, trusting Allah as the ultimate Provider of heirs.
reflection: Encourages patience and trust in Allah for blessings of family, even when it seems unlikely by worldly standards.

arabic: فَنَادَىٰ فِي ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ أَن لَّآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنتَ سُبْحَٰنَكَ إِنِّي كُنتُ مِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
transliteration: La ilaha illa anta, subhanaka, inni kuntu minaz-zalimeen.
english: There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers.
turkish: Allah'ım, Senden başka ilah yoktur; Seni her türlü eksiklikten tenzih ederim; ben gerçekten zalimlerden oldum.
context: Prophet Yunus called this from the darkness of the whale’s belly, affirming Allah’s oneness and admitting his mistake.
reflection: Teaches sincere repentance and humility: even in dire straits, affirm the oneness of Allah and admit our faults.

arabic: رَبِّ إِنِّي لِمَا أَنزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
transliteration: Rabbi inni lima anzalta ilayya min khayrin faqeer.
english: My Lord, indeed I am in need of whatever good You send down to me.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana indirdiğin her türlü iyilikte muhtacım.
context: After fleeing Egypt, Prophet Musa prayed for Allah’s sustenance, acknowledging his dependence on Allah’s bounty.
reflection: Encourages seeking Allah’s help in need and trusting His provision after our own efforts.

arabic: رَبِّ ٱشْرَحْ لِي صَدْرِي وَيَسِّرْ لِيٓ أَمْرِي وَٱحْلُلْ عُقْدَةًۢ مِّن لِّسَانِي يَفْقَهُوا۟ قَوْلِي
transliteration: Rabbi ishrah li sadri wa yassir li amri wa ḥḷul 'uqdata min lisani yafqahu qawli.
english: My Lord, expand my chest for me, and ease my task for me, and untie the knot from my tongue that they may understand my speech.
turkish: Rabbim! Gönlümü genişlet, işimi kolaylaştır, dilimin bağını çöz ki sözümü anlasınlar.
context: Prophet Musa asked Allah for confidence and clarity when delivering Allah’s message to Pharaoh.
reflection: Encourages asking Allah for confidence and eloquence in difficult tasks, acknowledging our dependence on Him.

arabic: رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَصْلِحْ لِي فِي ذُرِّيَّتِيۖ إِنِّي تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَإِنِّي مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi awzi'ni an ashkura ni'mataka allatee an'amta 'alayya wa 'ala walidayya wa an a'mala salihan tardahu wa aslih li fi dhurriyyati innī tubtu ilayka wa innī mina al-muslimeen.
english: My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and my parents, and to do righteous deeds that You approve. And make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana ve anne babama bahşettiğin nimetlere şükretmeyi ve senin razı olacağın salih ameller yapmayı nasip et; soyumdan da salih kimseler yarat. Şüphesiz Sana tövbe ettim ve ben müslümanlardanım.
context: Prophet Sulaiman asked Allah to make him and his parents grateful and righteous, and to grant him righteous offspring.
reflection: Encourages gratitude for blessings and seeking Allah’s guidance for ourselves and our descendants in righteousness.

arabic: أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ ٱلضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّحِمِينَ
transliteration: Annee massaniyad durru wa anta arhamur rahimeen.
english: Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.
turkish: Rabbim! Gerçekten başıma bir felaket çöktü; Sen merhametlilerin en merhametlisisin.
context: Prophet Ayyub called upon Allah during severe illness, acknowledging Allah's infinite mercy.
reflection: Reminds us to turn to Allah in hardship with patience, trusting His mercy even in suffering.

arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةًۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ
transliteration: Rabbi hab li min ladunka dhurriyyatan tayyibatan innaka sami'u du'a.
english: My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana katından salih bir nesil bahşet. Sen duayı işitensin.
context: Prophet Zakariya prayed for a righteous child in old age, trusting Allah as the Hearer of prayers.
reflection: Encourages praying for righteous offspring and having faith that Allah hears all prayers.

arabic: رَبِّ قَدْ آتَيْتَنِي مِنَ ٱلْمُلْكِ وَعَلَّمْتَنِي مِن تَأْوِيلِ ٱلْأَحَادِيثِۖ فَاطِرَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ أَنتَ وَلِيِّي فِي ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْآخِرَةِۖ تَوَفَّنِي مُسْلِمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
transliteration: Rabbi qad aataytani minal-mulki wa 'allamtani min ta'wili al-ahadeeth; fatir as-samawati wal-ard, anta waliyyi fid-dunya wal-akhirah; tawaffani musliman wa alhiqni bis-salihin.
english: My Lord, You have given me of the sovereignty and taught me interpretation of dreams. You are my Protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous.
turkish: Rabbim! Bana hükümdarlık ve rüya tabirini öğrettin. Sen dünyada da ahirette de benim koruyucumsun. Beni Müslüman olarak vefat ettir ve beni salihlerle birlikte kıl.
context: Prophet Yusuf thanked Allah for his kingship and wisdom, praying to remain a believer and join the righteous after death.
reflection: Shows gratitude for blessings and trust in Allah’s protection, and reminds us to seek to join the righteous in the hereafter.

arabic: رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍۢ مِّن بَعْدِيۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْوَهَّابُ
transliteration: Rabbi ighfir li wahab li mulkan la yanbaghi li ahadin min ba'di innaka anta al-wahhab.
english: My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom that will not befit anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower.
turkish: Rabbim! Beni bağışla, bana benden sonra kimseye yaraşmayacak bir saltanat bahşet. Şüphesiz Sen çok vericisin.
context: Prophet Solomon asked Allah for a unique kingdom, acknowledging Allah as the ultimate Giver.
reflection: Reminds us to humbly seek Allah’s blessings and mercy, trusting in His generosity for exceptional guidance or success.

arabic: فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ الْغَافِرِينَ
transliteration: Faghfir lana warhamna wa anta khayrul-ghaafireen.
english: So forgive us and have mercy on us. Indeed, You are the best of those who forgive.
turkish: Bizi affet, bize merhamet et; sen şüphesiz bağışlayanların en hayırlısısın.
context: Prophet Musa prayed for forgiveness and mercy for himself and his people after their trial with the golden calf.
reflection: Encourages seeking Allah’s forgiveness and mercy especially after sin, knowing He is the Most Forgiving.

arabic: رَبَّنَا ٱفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَنَا وَٱنْصُرْنَا عَلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ
transliteration: Rabbana afrigh 'alayna sabran wa thabbit aqdamana wa ansurna 'ala al-qawmi al-kaafireen.
english: Our Lord, pour patience on us, make our feet firm, and give us victory over the disbelieving people.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Bize sabır ver, ayaklarımızı sağlamlaştır ve bize kâfirler kavmi karşısında zafer ver.
context: Prophet Dawud (David) made this prayer before battling Goliath, seeking Allah’s steadfastness and help against the enemy.
reflection: Reminds us to seek Allah’s support in trials, asking for patience and success when facing overwhelming odds.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّنَآ أَنزِلْ عَلَيْنَا مَآئِدَةً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ تَكُونُ لَنَا عِيدًا لِّأَوَّلِنَا وَءَاخِرِنَا وَءَايَةً مِّنكَۖ وَٱرْزُقْنَا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
transliteration: Allahumma Rabbana anzil 'alayna ma'idatan minal-sama'i takoonu lana 'eedan li awwalina wa akhirina wa aayatan minka wa arzuqna wa anta khayru ar-raziqeen.
english: O Allah, our Lord! Send down to us a table spread with food from heaven, to be a festival for us and a sign from You. Provide for us; You are the best of providers.
turkish: Allah'ımız! Gökte bize bir yemek sofrası indir. Bu bizim için bayram olsun ve Senin bir mucizen olsun. Bize rızık ver; Sen rızık verenlerin en hayırlısısın.
context: Prophet Isa (Jesus) and his disciples asked for a feast from heaven; he prayed to Allah as the Lord and Provider.
reflection: Encourages trusting Allah for needs and viewing His provisions as blessings and signs of His care.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ عِلْمًا نَافِعًا وَرِزْقًا طَيِّبًا وَعَمَلًا مُتَقَبَّلًا
transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka 'ilman nafi'an wa rizqan tayyiban wa 'amalan mutaqabbalan.
english: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, goodly provision, and deeds that are accepted.
turkish: Allahım! Sen’den faydalı bilgi, helal ve güzel rızık, ve kabul edilen salih ameller dilerim.
context: Prophet Muhammad recited this du’a seeking useful knowledge, lawful sustenance, and righteous deeds.
reflection: Encourages prioritizing beneficial knowledge, lawful sustenance and accepted deeds in our supplications.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلَامُ وَمِنْكَ السَّلَامُ تَبَارَكْتَ ذَا الْجَلاَلِ وَالإِكْرَامِ
transliteration: Allahumma anta as-salam wa minka as-salam tabarakta dha al-jalali wal-ikram.
english: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Possessor of Majesty and Honor.
turkish: Allahım! Sen Selametsin; esenlik Senden gelir. Büyüklük ve lütuf sahibi olarak mübareksin.
context: After concluding prayer, the Prophet Muhammad said this du’a praising Allah as the source of peace and blessing His Majesty.
reflection: Reminds us that true peace and blessings come from Allah alone, and teaches us to honor Him as the source of all goodness.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ وَمِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ وَمِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْمَحْيَا وَالْمَمَاتِ وَمِنْ شَرِّ فِتْنَةِ الْمَسِيحِ الدَّجَّالِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min 'adhabi jahannam wa min 'adhabi-l-qabr wa min fitnati-l-mahya wa-l-mamat wa min sharri fitnati-l-masihid-dajjal.
english: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell, from the punishment of the grave, from the trials of life and death, and from the evil of the Antichrist.
turkish: Allahım! Sana cehennem azabından, kabir azabından, hayat ve ölüm fitnelerinden ve Deccal’ın şerrinden sığınırım.
context: Prophet Muhammad would seek Allah’s protection from major trials and punishments at the end of his prayer.
reflection: Encourages relying on Allah’s protection from severe trials, emphasizing belief in the Hereafter and the Day of Judgment.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّي عَلَىٰ ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
transliteration: Allahumma a'inni 'ala dhikrika wa shukrika wa husni 'ibadatika.
english: O Allah, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best of ways.
turkish: Allahım! Sizi anmamda, size şükretmemde ve ibadetimi en güzel şekilde yapmamda bana yardım et.
context: Prophet Muhammad recommended this supplication after prayer, asking Allah’s help in remembering Him, showing gratitude, and proper worship.
reflection: Reminds us to ask Allah’s help in staying mindful, grateful, and sincere in our worship.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ ٱلْهَمِّ وَٱلْحُزْنِ وَٱلْعَجْزِ وَٱلْكَسَلِ وَٱلْبُخْلِ وَٱلْجُبْنِ وَغَلَبَةِ ٱلدَّيْنِ وَقَهْرِ ٱلرِّجَالِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-hammi wal-hazan, wal-'ajzi wal-kasal, wal-bukhli wal-jubn, wa ghalabati-d-dayni wa qahrir-rijal.
english: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and grief, from incapacity and laziness, from miserliness and cowardice, and from being overwhelmed by debt or by men.
turkish: Allah'ım! Sana sıkıntı ve kederden, güçsüzlük ve tembellikten, cimrilik ve korkaklıktan, borç yükünün ve insanların baskısının altında kalmaktan sana sığınırım.
context: Prophet Muhammad taught this supplication seeking Allah’s protection from various forms of hardship and evil.
reflection: Highlights the importance of seeking Allah’s help to avoid common life’s difficulties and dangers.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي ظُلْمًا كَثِيرًا وَلاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ ...
transliteration: Allahumma inni zalamtu nafsi zulman kathiran, wa la yaghfiru adh-dhunuba illa anta, faghfir li maghfiratan min 'indika, warhamni, innaka anta al-ghafoorur-rahim.
english: O Allah, I have greatly wronged myself and none forgives sins except You. Grant me forgiveness and mercy, for You are the Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
turkish: Allah'ım! Kendime çok büyük zulmettim, günahları affedecek olan ancak Sensin. Senden mağfiret ve rahmet dilerim; çünkü Sen en çok bağışlayansın, en çok merhametlisin.
context: The Prophet said this after hearing about minor sins, demonstrating deep repentance before Allah.
reflection: Shows the importance of sincere repentance and recognizing that only Allah can forgive sins, encouraging us to seek His mercy.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ عَفُوٌّ تُحِبُّ العَفْوَ فَاعْفُ عَنِّي
transliteration: Allahumma innaka 'afuwwun tuhibbu al-'afwa fa'fu 'anni.
english: O Allah, You are Most Forgiving; You love forgiveness, so forgive me.
turkish: Allah'ım! Sen affedicilerin en enginsin; affetmeyi seversin; o halde beni affet.
context: This du’a was taught for Laylat al-Qadr, the Night of Power, to seek Allah’s forgiveness.
reflection: Highlights Allah’s attribute of forgiveness and teaches us to sincerely ask for His pardon.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْعَفْوَ وَالْعَافِيَةَ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka al-'afwa wal-'afiyata fid-dunya wal-akhirah.
english: O Allah, I ask You for forgiveness and well-being in this world and the Hereafter.
turkish: Allahım! Senden dünyada ve ahirette af ve esenlik dilerim.
context: The Prophet recited this supplication regularly, seeking Allah’s forgiveness and wellness in both lives.
reflection: Encourages asking Allah for a balanced life – forgiveness of sins and good in this life and the next.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا، آتِنِي فِي الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وَقِنِي عَذَابَ النَّارِ
transliteration: Allahumma Rabbas-samawati wal-ard, atini fid-dunya hasanatan wa fil-akhirati hasanatan wa qini 'adhaban-nar.
english: O Allah, Lord of the heavens and earth, grant me good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and protect me from the punishment of the Fire.
turkish: Allah'ım! Göklerin ve yerin Rabbi, bana dünyada güzellik, ahirette güzellik ver ve cehennem azabından koru.
context: This was among the Prophet’s du’as, asking for all-around goodness and salvation from Hell.
reflection: Teaches seeking Allah’s blessings comprehensively – good in all affairs, and protection from punishment.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ زَوَالِ نِعْمَتِكَ وَتَحَوُّلِ عَافِيَتِكَ وَفُجَاءَةِ نِقْمَتِكَ
transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika min zawali ni'matika wa tahawwuli 'afiyatika wa fujaa'ati niqmatika.
english: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the loss of Your blessing, the change of Your protection, and the sudden onset of Your punishment.
turkish: Allah'ım! Senden nimetlerinin gitmesinden, esenliğinin kaybolmasından, ansızın azaba yakalanmaktan sana sığınırım.
context: Prophet Muhammad sought refuge from losing Allah’s blessings and being suddenly afflicted.
reflection: Reminds us to be grateful for blessings and seek Allah’s protection from losing them or facing trials.

arabic: رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
transliteration: Rabbana hab lana min azwajina wa dhurriyyatina qurrata a'yunin waj'alna lilmuttaqeena imama.
english: Our Lord, grant us from among our spouses and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us leaders of the righteous.
turkish: Rabbimiz! Bize eşlerimizden ve çocuklarımızdan gözlerimizi aydınlatacak güzellikler ver ve bizi takvâ sahiplerinin önderi kıl.
context: Prophet Ibrahim prayed for righteous families and to be leaders among the pious.
reflection: Encourages praying for blessing in one’s family and striving to be examples of faith.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
transliteration: Allahumma inni as'aluka al-jannah wa a'udhu bika min an-nar.
english: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and seek refuge in You from the Fire.
turkish: Allah'ım! Senden cenneti dilerim ve cehennem ateşinden Sana sığınırım.
context: Prophet Muhammad recommended reciting this after prayers, seeking entry into Paradise and protection from Hell.
reflection: Highlights the believer’s ultimate hope in Paradise and seeking refuge from Hell in du’a.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَىٰ كَلِمَتِكَ لَا يَبْلَىٰ
transliteration: Allahumma inni tawakkaltu 'ala kalimatika la yablaa.
english: O Allah, I rely on Your Word which never perishes.
turkish: Allah'ım! Sözünün yok olmayacağına inanarak Sana güveniyorum.
context: Prophet Muhammad said this to express absolute trust in Allah’s eternal promise.
reflection: Encourages relying on Allah’s unchanging word and promises rather than on worldly support.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ أَصْلِحْ لِي دِينِي الَّذِي هُوَ عِصْمَةُ أَمْرِي
transliteration: Allahumma aslih li deeni alladhi huwa 'ismatu amri.
english: O Allah, set right my religion, which is the safeguard of all my affairs.
turkish: Allah'ım! Tüm işlerimin sigortası olan dinimi benim için sağlamlaştır.
context: Prophet Muhammad taught this after prayer, asking Allah to keep his faith firm, as it safeguards all affairs.
reflection: Emphasizes that the integrity of one’s faith is central to one’s life and that we should seek Allah’s help to maintain it.

arabic: اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي سَمْعِي اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَصَرِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
transliteration: Allahumma 'afini fi badani, Allahumma 'afini fi sam'i, Allahumma 'afini fi basari, la ilaha illa anta.
english: O Allah, grant health to my body, to my hearing, and to my sight; there is no deity but You.
turkish: Allah'ım! Bedenime, işitme duyuma ve görme duyuma sağlık ver; Senden başka ilah yoktur.
context: The Prophet used this supplication to ask Allah for protection and health of his body, hearing, and sight.
reflection: Reminds us to ask Allah to preserve our faculties and to be grateful for the health He provides.
